de.unlixx.runpng.util

Class Loc

  • java.lang.Object

  • public class Loc
extends java.lang.Object
    Localization manager.

    • Method Detail

      • getFallback

        public static java.util.Locale getFallback()
        This gets a fallback locale for the case that a user specific locale is not available.
        Returns:
        The fallback Locale which is Locale.ENGLISH actually.

      • getString

        public static java.lang.String getString(java.lang.String strKey)
        Obtains a language specific string resource by key.
        Parameters:
        strKey - The key connected to the string resource.
        Returns:
        The obtained resource string or an empty string.

      • getString

        public static java.lang.String getString(java.lang.String strKey,
                                         java.lang.Object... args)
        Obtains a language specific string resource by key and completes it with variable arguments.
        Parameters:
        strKey - The key connected to the string resource.
        args - A variable arguments list.
        Returns:
        The obtained resource string or an empty string.

      • getLocalesList

        public static java.util.List<java.util.Locale> getLocalesList()
        To obtain the list of currently installed language locales.
        Returns:
        The list of installed language locales.

      • getListedLocale

        public static java.util.Locale getListedLocale(java.util.Locale locale)
        This method checks the locales list for a specific language locale.
        Parameters:
        locale - The locale to find a language locale for.
        Returns:
        The language locale if found in the list or the fallback locale.

      • localeChanged

        public static void localeChanged(java.util.Locale locale)
        This needs to be invoked when a locale change happens.
        Parameters:
        locale - The new Locale object.

      • getLanguage

        public static java.lang.String getLanguage()
        Gets the current ISO 639 two characters locale id. If no current locale has been set then it gets the id of the fallback language.
        Returns:
        A string containing a two characters locale id.

      • getISO3Language

        public static java.lang.String getISO3Language()
        Gets the current ISO 639-2 three characters locale id. If no current locale has been set then it gets the id of the fallback language.
        Returns:
        A string containing a three characters locale id.

      • addIdTextObject

        public static void addIdTextObject(java.lang.Object obj)
        Adds an id-text-object. This means an object which have a String getId() and a setText(String) method. The id of these objects must be the same as a text id in the resource bundle. In that case the text label can be changed according to a possible locale change.
        Parameters:
        obj - An object with a String getId() and a setText(String) method.

      • addChangeListener

        public static void addChangeListener(Loc.ChangeListener listener)
        Add a locale change listener to the list.
        Parameters:
        listener - A listener which implements the Loc.ChangeListener interface.

      • removeChangeListener

        public static void removeChangeListener(Loc.ChangeListener listener)
        Remove a locale change listener from the list.
        Parameters:
        listener - A listener which implements the Loc.ChangeListener interface.
